poem:
**In This Uneasy Light**

From the paper's edge, a tale unfolds,  
tanks and airstrikes etch the morning,  
92 voices rise to silence UNRWA,  
a generation's echo, displaced and unmended.  
Amidst these lines, I sip my coffee,  
wondering if hope,  
like ink,  
will spill across the page,  
or be blotted out.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Israeli airstrikes and tank advances reported in Lebanon 9.02am GMT Why has Israel’s parliament voted to ban Unrwa? On Monday 92 Israeli MPs voted for a measure to ban Unrwa’s activities in Israel while only 10 voted to oppose the measure. A second bill severed diplomatic relations with the agency. Israel has long complained that Unrwa is obsolete and its continuing support of the descendants of those initially displaced in 1948". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
